abstract.p: NASA Asst Admr Glenn Mahone letter holds that agency does not plan any specific support for film The Day After Tomorrow because producers have not signed cooperation agreement

block.p: Re ''NASA Curbs Comments on Ice Age Disaster Movie'' (news article, April 25):

At first, a number of NASA representatives assisted with the development of the movie ''The Day After Tomorrow.'' But NASA requires film producers to sign a cooperation agreement before any formal support is provided.
Re ''NASA Curbs Comments on Ice Age Disaster Movie'' (news article, April 25):

At first, a number of NASA representatives assisted with the development of the movie ''The Day After Tomorrow.'' But NASA requires film producers to sign a cooperation agreement before any formal support is provided.
This is a standard agency procedure that has succeeded with blockbusters like ''Armageddon'' and ''Space Cowboys.''
But the producers of ''The Day After Tomorrow'' have not signed an agreement. As such, NASA does not plan any specific support of this production.

We do not try to control or modify the scientific findings of those engaged in climate change research. Indeed, the taxpayers provide more than $1 billion a year for NASA climate change research. As always, we will answer any scientific questions that arise attendant to the movie's release.
GLENN MAHONE Assistant Administrator of Public Affairs, NASA Washington, April 26, 2004
